thread.title: Register Now for Brain Bolt 5K for Brain Aneurysm Awareness Event Benefitting Brain Aneurysm Foundation and Goodman Campbells Neurosurgery Foundation

author: cbs8
title: Register Now for Brain Bolt 5K for Brain Aneurysm Awareness Event Benefitting Brain Aneurysm Foundation and Goodman Campbells Neurosurgery Foundation
text:
New event fostering awareness and celebrating those impacted by brain aneurysms scheduled for October 11th
Hanover, MA (PRWEB) October 05, 2015
Please register today and join the Brain Bolt 5K for Brain Aneurysm Awareness on Sunday, October 11, 2015 hosted by Goodman Campbell Brain and Spine.
All proceeds benefit the Brain Aneurysm Foundation and the Neurosurgery Foundation at Goodman Campbell as both renowned organizations fight the devastation caused by brain aneurysms.
Scheduled for Sunday, October 11th, the Brain Bolt 5K for Brain Aneurysm Awareness will take place at Marian University, which is located at 3200 Cold Spring Road in Indianapolis, IN. Registration on the day of the event begins at 8:00am; and the 5K kicks off promptly at 9:00am. There is also a childrenâ€™s race, which is set to begin following the 5K.
The fee to participate is $30. Youth 12 and under are free. Registration is also available on the day of the event for $35.
Please consider becoming a Virtual Participant if you are unable to attend the event. By registering as a Virtual Participant, you can support brain aneurysm research and receive a complimentary t-shirt.
For more information about the Brain Bolt 5K for Brain Aneurysm Awareness please visit the event website by clicking here and/or contact Brainbolt5K(at)goodmancampbell(dot)com.
The Brain Aneurysm Foundation was established in 1994 in Boston, Massachusetts with a mission to promote early detection of brain aneurysms by providing knowledge and raising awareness of the signs, symptoms and risk factors; work with the medical communities to provide support networks for patients and families; as well as to further research that will improve patient outcomes and save lives. For more information about the Brain Aneurysm Foundation, visit http://www.bafound.org .
